title: SOLD OUT - Mushroom Hike at Sugarloaf
location: Sugarloaf Ridge State Park, 2605 Adobe Canyon Rd, Kenwood, CA
description:
Explore the hidden world beneath our feet on this mushroom hike led by local mycologist George Riner. We‚Äôll observe their growth, learn to identify different species by key traits, be mesmerized by the display of colors, shapes, textures, and discuss these remarkable organisms‚Äô ecological roles, culinary delights, and even a touch of folklore. 
Be prepared for two miles of leisurely walking and chatting over moderate and possibly muddy terrain. Please be aware this is not a foray; collection is permitted for this activity through a yearly CA State Parks Scientific Research and Collecting permit. Fungi information is for educational purposes only. Foraging is illegal in CA State Parks. 
You must purchase a ticket through this page to attend. Tickets are $10 for general audiences, $5 for students, youth (12-17 years old; children under 18 years old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian), Sugarloaf members, Sugarloaf and RFO volunteers, and free for children under 12. Meet outside the Visitor Center ten minutes prior to the event start time. 
Wear layers and appropriate footwear for muddy/slippery trails, bring at least a quart of water, and if you have them, mushroom identifying guides. We invite you to bring a reusable drink container so your little ones can enjoy hot cocoa after the walk, if desired. Heavy rain cancels; parking fees apply. Parking fees apply.

Source: GoLocal Cooperative

After the walk, continue the experience with a visit to The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms, where expertly crafted miniature landscapes highlight the artistry and harmony of nature. This immersive experience celebrates the beauty of the season through flowers, culture, and living art.

Get to Know Us 
Formed in the vibrant cultural backdrop of the San Francisco Bay Area in 1992, Gold Dead began as the Fillmore Brothers. description:
Shut Up & Write!¬Æ Wine Country
**Coworking for writers in Petaluma!**
Join us for some focused writing time. All experience levels are welcome, and don‚Äôt worry, no one will see what you've written. This session is about getting some writing done, whether you're working on a novel, memoir, short story, dissertation, job application, blog, poetry, a song or just want to journal.

**Format**
10:30 - 10:45am: Introduce yourself and what you're working on today
10:45 - 11:45am: Write in silence for 1 hour
11:45am - 12pm: Check in with one another and exchange how it went

**Venue Details:**

* Aqus has WiFi for guests
* Ample street parking is available
* Please thank our hosts by purchasing something
* If music or ambient noise are distracting, please bring ear plugs or headphones
* There are a few outlets available if you need to charge your device

Back to All Shows


Peppa Pig: My First Concert

Wednesday, February 18, 2026

6:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Peppa Pig: My First Concert is a fun, interactive introduction to a live orchestra for ages 18 months and older. Peppa and George learn all about the different sounds that instruments make together and enjoy some of their favorite music from the British animated series, performed by Southbank Sinfonia Youth Orchestra. They also get to discover some other exciting orchestral pieces perfect for children. Little piggies can join in with Peppa and her family and make music of their own! 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. title: Yoga Vinyasa Krama
description:
Nataraja School of Traditional Yoga
**Yoga Vinyasa Krama - Thursdays 9-10:30am**
**Soft Medicine Sanctuary - Loft**

Experience physical health & fitness, pranic flow, vital energy & stillness - through intelligent architecture with the metaphysics of deep conscious breathing & slow motion, yogic breathwork, mantra/sound/vibration, mudra, subtle & contemplative practices.

Yoga Vinyasa Krama is a comprehensive hatha-raja yogic system for purification, developing concentration, neuromuscular fitness and conditioning, mastering the breath, awakening subtle energy and stilling the mind. Based on deep breathing & the subtle movement of prana directed into the cartilage tissue, sinuous musculature, internal organs, nerve pathways and nadis. It has over 700 intelligently sequenced slow, conscious breath powered with precision movement variations with pause (vinyasas), exploring many aesthetic variations of each posture to correctly establish the main asanas while the mind merges with the breath.
Includes drishti, pratikriyas, bandha, vaseth, mudra, mantra, surya & ding namaskar with breath & mantra, cleansing kriyas, Himalayan pranayama including including ujjayi variations, heating & cooling breaths, solar, lunar & soli-lunar nadi shuddhi practices, pranava & samantraka pranayama, pratyahara, subtle & contemplative practices in 12 kramas (sequences).

The whole process gradually transforms the body and mind, releasing old patterns of physical and mental tension and dysfunctional patterns of movement, providing tonic, energetic and psychophysiological effects. This system is presented from the teachings Srivatsa Ramaswami learned through his over 33 years of one on one study with Sri Krishnamacharya and teachings from a similar Himalayan method.

This ongoing class will explore the entire system of 12 Kramas with each class focusing on a particular krama (sequence) & pranayama & contemplative practices.

Please practice on an empty stomach. Morning beverage ok but please take it 30min or more before class.

$25 Drop In, Discounted Class Passes & Memberships
Register -[https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true](https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true)

Join us for some focused writing time. All experience levels are welcome, and don‚Äôt worry, no one will see what you've written. This session is about WRITING, whether you're working on a novel, memoir, play, short story, dissertation, job application, blog, poetry, journal, or song.

**This event is hosted on the Shut Up & Write website, so please [sign up here](https://shutupwrite.com/series/shut-up-write-online-with-lorraine-s/7480) for your writing event.**

**ABOUT THE EVENT**
Welcome! I will email passcode to those who register.
Be sure to enable email on MeetUp!
Then, please check your email!
Join us virtually for an hour + of writing using Zoom. Let's keep together as much as we can during these uncertain times and keep on writing. Look for the schedule online and join us.

We‚Äôve discovered that it‚Äôs strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it‚Äôs true for you at 3pm on Friday afternoon. Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

JOIN US!

1. RSVP - space is limited to 12 people. (registration closes at one half hour before the event starts). You will receive the link to access the event at that time. REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR PASSCODE!
2. Before or at 3pm join the meeting with the link you receive AND ADD PASSCODE.

Please note:

1. If you don't have Zoom set up on your computer yet, leave 15-30 minutes ahead of time to get it set up!
2. If you have difficulty with audio (don't have a microphone set up), as long as you have a speaker, you can call in (you'll see phone numbers when you log in).
3. If you are late, you won't be able to intro with us, but you are still welcome to join in.
4. If you won't be able to make it, please cancel so that the space is available to another writer.

SCHEDULE:
3:00 - quick intros.
around 3:10 - timer starts: write for 70 mins.
4:20 - (the end) wrap up

Wherever you are, we hope to see you online! Keep on writing...
Regards,
Lorraine Segal

Source: Meetup: Shut Up & Write Wine Country

title: Paint Your Pet in Watercolor: SebArts & Humane Society of Sonoma County ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Out of Stock
      
    




Paint Your Pet in Watercolor: SebArts & Humane Society of SoCo

  
    
      
        
          $95.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, February 21, 2026; 1:00 ‚Äì 4:00pm$80.00 + $15 Materials FeeJoin us for a collaborative community event, a joyful, inclusive art experience celebrating the bond between people and animals while supporting local art education and animal welfare. We invite participants to create a portrait of their beloved pet, under the guidance of an experienced Teaching Artist, with proceeds shared between SebArts and the Humane Society of Sonoma County. The event will blend creativity and compassion - core values shared by both organizations. Paint Your Pet is a 3 hour guided painting workshop where participants bring a photo of their pet (or choose from adoptable pets featured by the Humane Society) and learn to create a custom portrait using watercolor paint. Celebrate the human animal bond through art and creative expression while raising funds to support SebArts art programs and the Humane Society of Sonoma County‚Äôs animal care and adoption services.About the Instructor: Hannah Day received her BA in Visual Arts with an emphasis on drawing and printmaking from University of San Diego, then attended University of Hawaii at Manoa to receive her MFA in printmaking. Hannah‚Äôs etchings have been internationally shown and collected, but her personal practice also includes paper cutting, graphite, watercolor, mixed media, and murals. She have taught all ages and many formats (kids, teens, adults, college, private lessons, camps, etc) and many mediums. These days Hannah has been teaching primarily paper cutting but also enjoys teaching drawing, painting and printmaking.

title: ReVision: Writers ReGroup ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
ReVision: Writers ReGroup 2/22/26

  
    
      
        
          $35.00
        
      
    
  

Sunday, February 22, 2026; 1pm-3:30pm$35 Write your way into a productive and rewarding relationship with revision!Session Focus: Whole-body Characters We‚Äôll explore ways to create vivid people on the page and strengthen other elements through character, including point of view, sense of place, and emotional resonance.Revision is to a first draft what marriage is to falling head-over heels. It is to free write what deep friendship is to casual meeting. Revision takes time, skill, caring, and fortitude. It asks that we be generous and also draw boundaries. It presents us with choices that challenge what we believe to be true about others and ourselves. Revision is not for the faint of heart, but for writers committed to their relationship with creative expression through all the rough patches. Revision allows writers to investigate their heart work and intentions and stay true.I‚Äôll share a process that I call ‚ÄúMaster Craft Juggling,‚Äù which incorporates my Nine Ways to Mastery approach for writing fiction, memoir, and nonfiction. The session includes a craft presentation, group discussion, and writing time.You will:‚Ä¢ Gain perspectives and techniques for masterful revision‚Ä¢ Build community with writers who may become trusted readers for your projects‚Ä¢ Improve your writing and writing practice through revision‚Ä¢ Move your projects toward publicationPlease bring your:‚Ä¢ Open mind‚Ä¢ Fiction or nonfiction free write, early draft, or manuscript in progress‚Ä¢ Tools and materials for writing during the session‚Ä¢ Writing and revision challenges to discuss, particularly as relate to the session focusThe workshop will be offered periodically with a particular focus each time. Check the schedule, and sign up when you‚Äôre ready to revise.About the Instructor: Christine Walker is a visual artist, author, and strategic visioning consultant. Her published books include the novel ‚ÄúTap Dancing at the Bluebird,‚Äù the memoir ‚ÄúA Painter‚Äôs Garden: Cultivating the Creative Life,‚Äù the children‚Äôs book and songs ‚ÄúWooleycat‚Äôs Musical Theater,‚Äù and books on writing craft ‚Äî ‚ÄúA Writer‚Äôs Resolution: A Guided Journal for Realizing a Rewarding Writing Practice‚Äù and, for publication in 2027, ‚ÄúOur Writing Minds in Play: The Nine Ways Guide to Masterful Fiction & Memoir.‚Äù Her paintings are exhibited in galleries and corporate and private collections. She holds an MFA in Writing and Literature in Fiction from Bennington College and an MA in Creative Arts Interdisciplinary from San Francisco State University. The Bennington program promised: ‚ÄúRead one hundred books. Write one.‚Äù This motto inspired her to design teaching frameworks and courses‚ÄîMaster Craft Juggling, Nine Ways to Mastery, Read to Write Books‚Äîto help writers elevate their writing practice and readers to engage more deeply in enjoying and discussing books. Throughout her multi-faceted creative career, she‚Äôs found that resilience is key to a rewarding career in the arts. She brings that resilience to teaching revision as a writing skill, as well as a practice.

title: Lake Sonoma Hike
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Wildflowers are early this year, and I have already seen some Orchids. Join me in search of early wildflowers at Lake Sonoma. We'll hike through a magical madrone forest, take in beautiful expansive views of the Mayacamas Mountain range as well as the Dry Creek and Warm Springs arms of Lake Sonoma. We will visit some of the largest manzanita and madrone trees I've seen. Best for individuals and dogs with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet/Important Directions**
Little Flat Parking (A large gravel parking lot)
From Hwy 101 take Dry Creek Road west towards Lake Sonoma. Go up the hill and across the bridge over the lake. Pay Attention, it's the first right turn into "Little Flat" parking lot.
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive. It's often farther than you think.

**Group Hike #333**
Dry Creek, No Name, North Slope and Bummer trails - a loop hike
Length - +/-5 miles/8 kilometers
Elevation change - +/-900 feet/274 meters
Difficulty - 7+ out of 10 some short steep rocky sections
Must be sure footed (confident and competent)!
Exposures - +/-30 % sun/70% shade - creek crossings, rocky, muddy, poison oak, ticks/insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 68 oz./2 liters!
Dogs - Yes, must be healthy, well behaved and on a leash.
Facilities at trail head - None - Port O Potti about 1.5 miles in.
Cost - $5 cash
Parking -$7-day pass can be purchased on-site using a credit card through the Recreation.gov mobile app. Once on-site, follow the posted Scan & Pay instructions. You will need to download the free Recreation.gov mobile app prior to your arrival as some remote areas have limited or no cellular service. For more information about paying on-site, click here: [How Do I Use a Scan & Pay QR Code to Purchase an Activity Pass?](https://recreationonestoptest.servicenowservices.com/external?id=kb_article&sys_id=2011ea4a1b84bcd076c1dbdbe54bcb1d)
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water for your dog too, a hat, snack, layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course, we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**After Hike Gathering?**
Quail & Condor
Bakery and Caf√©
44 Mill St Unit J
Healdsburg, CA 95448
[https://www.quailandcondor.com/](https://www.quailandcondor.com/)
(707) 473-8254
Outstanding new location with plenty of parking and a beautiful cafe. Behind the Parish Caf√© at the roundabout.

**When We Meet**
Sunday February 22, 2026
9:00 am - 12:00 pm
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**"When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately."**

Source: Meetup: Go Wild Hikers

10:30 - 10:45am: Introduce yourself and what you're working on today
10:45 - 11:45am: Write in silence for 1 hour
11:45am - 12pm: Check in with one another and exchange how it went

* Please thank our hosts by purchasing something

* There are a few outlets available if you need to charge your device

title: BLACK DIAMOND DEMO RUN AT SB SANTA ROSA
location: SB Santa Rosa
description:
Sports Basement run clubs across Northern California are teaming up with Black Diamond for a special Deploy Headlamp Demo Run Series leading into daylight saving time. At each stop, runners will have the chance to demo the Black Diamond Deploy headlamp during an evening community run , getting real-world experience with a lightweight, low-profile, USB-C rechargeable headlamp designed specifically for runners. After each run, we‚Äôll wrap things up with a raffle featuring Black Diamond Deploy headlamps . This series will travel to nine Sports Basement run clubs across NorCal , bringing the same demo kit from store to store to create a consistent, shared experience across the region. All paces are welcome, and runs are designed to be social, approachable, and fun ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre new to night running or just looking for an excuse to get out with the community. What to expect across the series: Evening community runs at Sports Basement locations On-run Black Diamond Deploy headlamp demos Raffles for Deploy headlamps at each stop A welcoming, all-paces environment This demo series is a great opportunity to try before you buy , connect with your local run club, and get comfortable running after dark with gear built for it. Check out your local Sports Basement Strava Club for specific event information.

title: Morning Pranayama - Yogic Breathwork
description:
Nataraja School of Traditional Yoga
**Morning Pranayama - Traditional Yogic Breathwork with Kara Weimer**
**Wednesdays 8:30-9:30am**

Start your morning with traditional yogic breathwork beginning with purification techniques. Release toxins, clear and align the energy channels, strengthen the lungs, massage, tone & nourish internal organs, strengthen agni & digestion, oxygenate and improve blood flow, strengthen immunity & clear the mind. Implement various techniques to energize, focus & calm the mind & nervous system & harness the vital life force energy - with kumbhaka & bandha (breath holds and internal locks). Known to increase neuroplasticity, nitric oxide, and erase old mental and emotional patterns. Traditionally, pranayama is the doorway to access higher states of consciousness.

Throughout the ongoing class different practices will be presented. Learn Cleansing kriyas, Himalayan Pranayama including including Ujjayi Variations, Heating & Cooling Breaths, Solar, Lunar & Soli-Lunar Nadi Shuddhi practices, Samantraka Pranayama, Mudra, Pratyahara, Subtle & Contemplative Practices. Includes Pranava techniques for contemplation and merging with the vibration and sound of Om and Nada - internal sound current.

Please practice on an empty stomach.

Soft Medicine - Downstairs in Ananhata Studio
$25 - Drop in, Discounted Class Passes & Membership Options

title: Yoga Vinyasa Krama
description:
Nataraja School of Traditional Yoga
**Yoga Vinyasa Krama - Thursdays 9-10:30am**
**Soft Medicine Sanctuary - Loft**

Experience physical health & fitness, pranic flow, vital energy & stillness - through intelligent architecture with the metaphysics of deep conscious breathing & slow motion, yogic breathwork, mantra/sound/vibration, mudra, subtle & contemplative practices.

Yoga Vinyasa Krama is a comprehensive hatha-raja yogic system for purification, developing concentration, neuromuscular fitness and conditioning, mastering the breath, awakening subtle energy and stilling the mind. Based on deep breathing & the subtle movement of prana directed into the cartilage tissue, sinuous musculature, internal organs, nerve pathways and nadis. It has over 700 intelligently sequenced slow, conscious breath powered with precision movement variations with pause (vinyasas), exploring many aesthetic variations of each posture to correctly establish the main asanas while the mind merges with the breath.
Includes drishti, pratikriyas, bandha, vaseth, mudra, mantra, surya & ding namaskar with breath & mantra, cleansing kriyas, Himalayan pranayama including including ujjayi variations, heating & cooling breaths, solar, lunar & soli-lunar nadi shuddhi practices, pranava & samantraka pranayama, pratyahara, subtle & contemplative practices in 12 kramas (sequences).

The whole process gradually transforms the body and mind, releasing old patterns of physical and mental tension and dysfunctional patterns of movement, providing tonic, energetic and psychophysiological effects. This system is presented from the teachings Srivatsa Ramaswami learned through his over 33 years of one on one study with Sri Krishnamacharya and teachings from a similar Himalayan method.

This ongoing class will explore the entire system of 12 Kramas with each class focusing on a particular krama (sequence) & pranayama & contemplative practices.

Please practice on an empty stomach. Morning beverage ok but please take it 30min or more before class.

$25 Drop In, Discounted Class Passes & Memberships
Register -[https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true](https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true)

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

title: Shut Up & Write!‚Ñ¢ Santa Rosa REMOTE ZOOM FRIDAY
description:
Shut Up & Write!¬Æ Wine Country
**This event is hosted on the Shut Up & Write website, so please [sign up here](https://shutupwrite.com/series/shut-up-write-online-with-lorraine-s/7480) for your writing event.**

**ABOUT THE EVENT**
Welcome! I will email passcode to those who register.
Be sure to enable email on MeetUp!
Then, please check your email!
Join us virtually for an hour + of writing using Zoom. Let's keep together as much as we can during these uncertain times and keep on writing. Look for the schedule online and join us.

We‚Äôve discovered that it‚Äôs strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it‚Äôs true for you at 3pm on Friday afternoon. Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

JOIN US!

1. RSVP - space is limited to 12 people. (registration closes at one half hour before the event starts). You will receive the link to access the event at that time. REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR PASSCODE!
2. Before or at 3pm join the meeting with the link you receive AND ADD PASSCODE.

Please note:

1. If you don't have Zoom set up on your computer yet, leave 15-30 minutes ahead of time to get it set up!
2. If you have difficulty with audio (don't have a microphone set up), as long as you have a speaker, you can call in (you'll see phone numbers when you log in).
3. If you are late, you won't be able to intro with us, but you are still welcome to join in.
4. If you won't be able to make it, please cancel so that the space is available to another writer.

SCHEDULE:
3:00 - quick intros.
around 3:10 - timer starts: write for 70 mins.
4:20 - (the end) wrap up

Wherever you are, we hope to see you online! Keep on writing...
Regards,
Lorraine Segal

Source: Meetup: Shut Up & Write Wine Country

title: Collage Your Story with Catherine Cruz ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Collage Your Story with Catherine Cruz: Mar 1, 2026

  
    
      
        
          $130.00
        
      
    
  

Sunday, March 1, 2026; 11:00am - 3:00pmFee: $115 + $15 materials feeAges 16 and up; Located in Dining Room at SebArtsJoin French-American collage artist Catherine Cruz for a special, personalized workshop designed just for you! The word collage comes from the French verb coller, meaning "to glue," and is all about merging various materials to tell a visual story. Much like our lives, which are shaped by countless moments and experiences, collage pieces bring together fragments that reveal hidden connections and untold narratives. In this class, you‚Äôll reflect on what matters most to you and how that can be expressed through art. Catherine will help you release the need for perfection and trust your creative instincts. By the end of the workshop, you‚Äôll not only have a finished artwork but also a deeper connection to your creative potential and a renewed love for the art of collage.What you‚Äôll learn: Creative ways to incorporate your personal story in your art, Methods for sourcing interesting collage papers, Techniques for crafting textured, multi-layered collages, Strategies for refining your compositionYou are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to personalize your artwork like ephemera that represents your life, copies of photos, old letters, books, papers from memorable experiences or travels, or documents that hold meaning. If you‚Äôre not comfortable using these documents, you should make color copies of them. For this process, it is also best to make laser copies of your photographs.Supplies provided by instructor: some collage papers, acrylic medium, brushesCLICK HERE TO READ DOCUMENT PRIOR TO PURCHASING CLASSAbout the instructor: Catherine Cruz is a French-American artist whose work is informed by the textures and patterns created by the passing of time and the effects of the natural elements on the built environment. She has taught collage and mixed media in the Bay Area and France since 2019. Her background is in interior design and green building certification. She works from her home studio in Sebastopol, CA, and participates in Art Trails Open Studios. You may contact Catherine at beyouartstudio@gmail.com.

title: Intro to Observational Drawing ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Out of Stock
      
    




Intro to Observational Drawing

  
    
      
        
          $65.00
        
      
    
  

Wednesday, March 4, 2026; 6-9PM$55 + $10 Materials FeeAges 16+In this one day introductory workshop, participants will get a peek into the process of building one‚Äôs drawing abilities through developing close observational skills and learning fundamental drawing techniques. If you find this intro helpful and want to keep exploring, you can sign up for the 3 week class one month later.This course is for anyone who wants to practice and advance their drawing skills - beginners, those who haven‚Äôt practiced in years, or any artists who just want to learn more and practice with consistent feedback and guidance. Learning to draw is truly learning to see - a skill that anyone can be taught, practice, and hone. Through demonstration, practice, and reflective discussion, this class will explore the foundations of classical drawing techniques in a low pressure environment. Observational drawing gives all artists a foundation of practical knowledge and skills that infinitely expands the possibilities of what one can create. If your ideas feel limited by your drawing skills, if you feel frustrated or stuck in your painting practice, or if you simply want to start drawing and are looking for a way to begin, this is the class for you. About the Instructor: Hannah Day received her BA in Visual Arts with an emphasis on drawing and printmaking from University of San Diego, then attended University of Hawaii at Manoa to receive her MFA in printmaking. Hannah‚Äôs etchings have been internationally shown and collected, but her personal practice also includes paper cutting, graphite, watercolor, mixed media, and murals. She have taught all ages and many formats (kids, teens, adults, college, private lessons, camps, etc) and many mediums. These days Hannah has been teaching primarily paper cutting but also enjoys teaching drawing, painting and printmaking.

With a career spanning three decades,¬†Trisha¬†Yearwood is a Grammy¬Æ, CMA¬Æ, and ACM¬Æ award-winning icon whose powerhouse voice and passion have captivated millions. Singer, actress, author, chef, and entrepreneur, Yearwood has achieved multiplatinum success while continuing to evolve as an artist. Most recently, she released two acclaimed albums,¬†The Mirror, a deeply personal collection of songs co-written by Yearwood, and¬†Christmastime, a joyful holiday project featuring festive favorites, a new original, and sweeping orchestral arrangements. 
In 2019,¬†Trisha released¬†Every Girl, her first full-length country album in over a decade, which included an acoustic re-recording of her breakthrough single, ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs in Love With The Boy,‚Äù the most-listened-to country song by a female artist in Billboard‚Äôs Country Airplay Chart history.¬†Trisha‚Äôs influence continues to reach new heights, recently inducted into the Austin City Limits Hall of Fame, she also celebrated 25 years with the Grand Ole Opry, received the ACM Honors Icon Award and CMT Awards June Carter Cash Humanitarian Award. Beyond music, she is the Emmy¬Æ winning host of¬†Trisha‚Äôs Southern Kitchen, authored four New York Times bestsellers, and co-owns Nashville‚Äôs largest honky-tonk.

title: Yoga Vinyasa Krama
description:
Nataraja School of Traditional Yoga
**Yoga Vinyasa Krama - Thursdays 9-10:30am**
**Soft Medicine Sanctuary - Loft**

Experience physical health & fitness, pranic flow, vital energy & stillness - through intelligent architecture with the metaphysics of deep conscious breathing & slow motion, yogic breathwork, mantra/sound/vibration, mudra, subtle & contemplative practices.

Yoga Vinyasa Krama is a comprehensive hatha-raja yogic system for purification, developing concentration, neuromuscular fitness and conditioning, mastering the breath, awakening subtle energy and stilling the mind. Based on deep breathing & the subtle movement of prana directed into the cartilage tissue, sinuous musculature, internal organs, nerve pathways and nadis. It has over 700 intelligently sequenced slow, conscious breath powered with precision movement variations with pause (vinyasas), exploring many aesthetic variations of each posture to correctly establish the main asanas while the mind merges with the breath.
Includes drishti, pratikriyas, bandha, vaseth, mudra, mantra, surya & ding namaskar with breath & mantra, cleansing kriyas, Himalayan pranayama including including ujjayi variations, heating & cooling breaths, solar, lunar & soli-lunar nadi shuddhi practices, pranava & samantraka pranayama, pratyahara, subtle & contemplative practices in 12 kramas (sequences).

The whole process gradually transforms the body and mind, releasing old patterns of physical and mental tension and dysfunctional patterns of movement, providing tonic, energetic and psychophysiological effects. This system is presented from the teachings Srivatsa Ramaswami learned through his over 33 years of one on one study with Sri Krishnamacharya and teachings from a similar Himalayan method.

This ongoing class will explore the entire system of 12 Kramas with each class focusing on a particular krama (sequence) & pranayama & contemplative practices.

Please practice on an empty stomach. Morning beverage ok but please take it 30min or more before class.

$25 Drop In, Discounted Class Passes & Memberships
Register -[https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true](https://momence.com/Soft-Medicine-Sanctuary/Yoga-Vinyasa-Krama-/122789095?skipPreview=true)

title: Jizo Peace Project: Clay Gathering ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Jizo Peace Project: Clay Gathering for Remembrance and Peace, Mar

  
    
      
        
          $10.00
        
      
    
  

Friday, March 6, 2026; 1:30 ‚Äì 4:00pmDue to limited capacity, we are asking for a suggested donation of $10 to confirm your attendance. Bring a copy of your receipt at check-in to Painting/Drawing Studio adjacent to Ceramics StudioJoin us for a monthly, heart-centered gathering where we come together to create Jizo guardians out of clay‚Äîsymbols of compassion, protection, and peace. Rooted in the Buddhist tradition and echoed across many cultures, Jizo figures traditionally honor children and all who have passed, those in transition, and those in distress.This ongoing project is dedicated to remembering those lost to war, with a special focus now on the approximately 19,000 children who have perished in Israel and Gaza in recent years. Through the simple, meditative act of working with clay, we create benevolent beings that will become part of public exhibits and peace sites, offering spaces for reflection, mourning, and hope. Our gatherings conclude with a gentle ritual to honor the lives of these children.We meet from 1:30‚Äì4:00 pm on the first Friday of each month at SebArts, in the Painting & Drawing Room. The gathering is open to ages 12 - adult, and no prior clay experience is necessary‚Äîall clay and basic materials are supplied. Registration is required to participate.There is no fee for this class; donations are welcome to help cover materials and expenses. More than a class, this is a shared space of warmth and care‚Äîan opportunity to tend to our own hearts while taking part in love in action.

title: Bothe Napa Valley State Park
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Spring is almost here. **Daylight Savings Time Begins**
**Set your clocks Ahead One Hour or you'll miss the hike.** Join us for a hike in Napa Valley. Bothe is 1900 acres of beautiful redwoods, bay laurel, madrones and moss-covered Douglas fir, orchids, trilliums and wildflowers (in season), spotted owls, pileated woodpeckers and forest pigeons, springs, creeks and ferns. You will not be disappointed! A challenging hike, best for individuals with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet/Directions**
Bothe Napa Valley State Park
3801 St. Helena Hwy (Highway 29/128), Calistoga, CA 94515
The park is located approximately 5 miles north of St. Helena and 4 miles south of Calistoga on Highway 29/128.
After passing the **entrance & Pay Station** follow the road to a large parking area. There are bathrooms past this parking lot about 200 yards.
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive, pay park fee and use the toilet. It often takes longer than you think.

**After Hike Gathering?**
The Calistoga Creamery
1473 Lincoln Avenue, Calistoga 94515
https://www.yelp.com/biz/calistoga-creamery-calistoga
An outstanding ice cream shop! Opens at 12 pm Sat and Sun.
Organic ice cream and organic frozen yogurt, thick custom milk shakes, root beer floats and sundaes. No high fructose corn syrup, artificial colors or flavors. No hydrogenated oils and no GMOs.

**Group Hike #334**
Coyote Peak Trail to Ritchey Canyon Trail - A loop hike
Distance - 6 miles/9.7 kilometers
Elevation change - 1100 feet/335 meters
Difficulty - 7+ out of 10 - moderate
Exposures - 20 % sun/ 80% shade- rocky, creek crossings, mud, poison oak, ticks & insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 68 oz./2 liters
Dogs - Not permitted
Facilities at trail head - Shade, picnic table, restrooms down the road.
Cost - $5 cash
Parking - State Parks fee of $8 or free with your State Park Pass.
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water, a hat, a snack/lunch and layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course, we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**When We Meet**
Sunday March 8, 2026
**Daylight Savings Time Begins**
**Set your clocks Ahead One Hour or you'll miss the hike.**
9:00 am - 12:30 pm PDT
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**"When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately."**

Source: Meetup: Go Wild Hikers

title: Poetic Medicine: 03/10/26 ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Poetic Medicine: 03/10/26

  
    
      
        
          $15.00
        
      
    
  

Tuesday, March 10, 2026; 4:00 ‚Äì 5:30pm$15.00Max 18 Attendees, Pre-registration required(We are unable to offer refunds or transfers for this class. If you cannot attend, please consider it a donation. Thank you!)The practice of ‚Äúpoem making‚Äù offers a means to express the metaphors and meaning of the joys and suffering we experience in ourselves and bear witness to in others. Poetry can be a salve for the heart and soul. It is a way of speaking what is true in our hearts and is often difficult to access without a creative spark. You do not have to be a "poet" or even a "writer" to allow words and feelings to pour through your pen.Redwing Keyssar has been leading "poetic medicine" sessions through her work in Palliative Care at UCSF for the past 5 years. Her work has created an international community of people who, by listening to and writing poetry together, have healed wounds of grief and loss, helped "wounded healers," and provided resiliency to move forward on our life paths.Writing poetry in community is a bit like attending a meditation retreat. The instruction for most beginners when learning to meditate is to simply bring oneself back to the breath, each time the mind wanders. In poem-making, the instruction is to bring oneself back to the heart and along with a deep breath, see if one can open a little bit wider. When we witness each other in this process, in a circle of open-heartedness, something magical happens!This is an IN-PERSON gathering to establish a strong and safe creative community. We are all poets!About the Instructor: Judith Redwing Keyssar, RN has traversed an amazing 35+ year journey in the healing arts/healthcare. Redwing is an educator, end-of-life doula, author, poet, song-writer, ceremonialist, national presenter and frequent contributor to public issues about Palliative and End of Life Care. Redwing is currently the Director of Education at the MERI Center for Education in Palliative Care at UCSF/Mt. Zion. Her professional career includes being the Clinical Director at Zen Hospice Project and the Director of Palliative Care and Nursing at Jewish Family and Children‚Äôs Services from 2004-2018. She is a founder and adjunct faculty member of the California State University Shiley/Haynes Institute of Palliative Care, and has taught courses at OLLI at Sonoma State. Redwing is the author of an award-winning book, ‚ÄúLast Acts of Kindness; Lessons for the Living from the Bedsides of the Dying‚Äù and is the recipient of numerous awards in the field of Palliative Care. After studying with John Fox at the Institute for Poetic Medicine, her passion for using poetry as a healing modality has led to the development of a successful international program in Poetic Medicine, through her work at the UCSF MERI Center. Learn more about her here: https://redwingkeyssar.com/

title: Give 'Em the Arrow Again!  Ladies Night at the Archery Range
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
I'm super excited to be able to offer another ladies' Archery night in Santa Rosa! If you've ever had a curiosity about archery, this is your chance to find out more with a fun, interactive lesson.

We have reserved a special event with the indoor range on a Wednesday evening. It will consist of a basic lesson, and then we all get to practice shooting. Everyone will get ample time to practice, as they have many lanes.

This event is focused on a less-competitive, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere. All skill levels are encouraged. All equipment is provided by them, and we will probably get about an hour or hour and a half to practice.

I encourage everyone to bring a bottle of wine or a snack to share with the rest of the group (We usually end up with a lovely charcuterie and wine spread for everyone to enjoy). Closed toe shoes recommended.

There are 17 spots available, guests welcome. The ladies' group lesson and event is $30 person, paid to the range. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event in addition to the regular fee so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

Please only RSVP 'Yes' if you are able to make it, I will be doing a final headcount the day of the event. There is an attendance policy for all our events: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

Cheers, and hope to see you there!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

title: Clay Exploration Evenings: Lvl 2 ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Clay Exploration Evenings: Lvl 2, 3/12

  
    
      
        
          $255.00
        
      
    
  

Thursdays, March 12 - April 16, 2026 (6 sessions) 6 - 8:30pm$210 + $45 clay fee (pre-registration required)This course is designed for students wishing to explore hand-building techniques at an intermediate to advanced level and delve deeper into refining their clay skills. Each session will start with a demonstration of a specific technique related to functional and/or decorative pottery. Participants are invited to explore new ideas and to try pieces that might be of a more challenging nature. Some of what we can explore are freeform coil pots, soft slab work, hard slab technique, a variety of sculptural techniques and a sampling of the many stamping, carving and textural surface treatments on clay. We will investigate ways to use slips and glaze that will add color to the forms we create.About the Instructor: Michael Citrino has had a love affair with clay for over 50 years. After his college experience at California College of Arts and Crafts with Viola Frey and further work at Humboldt State University with Lew Merrick, he ran a stained glass business for 18 years. Michael and his wife left for Turkey in 1991 to teach in International Schools. For 26 years he taught K-12 art, including Ceramics, Drawing, Photography, Design and Sculpture at schools in six different countries. He started clay programs for High School and Middle School students at three of those schools. At four of these schools he offered after school and weekend ceramics sessions for teachers and parents. Michael‚Äôs work ranges from the traditional to the experimental and a wide swath in between. His approach to teaching is to help students explore the playful nature of the clay room and nurture a love for the possibilities that medium presents.

title: Outback Presents Whitney Cummings: The Big Baby Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Outback Presents 
Whitney Cummings: The Big Baby Tour

Saturday, March 14, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Whitney Cummings is a comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, and host of the hit podcast Good for You. Best known for creating and starring in the NBC series Whitney and co-creating the syndicated, Emmy-nominated CBS comedy 2 Broke Girls, she has become a leading voice in modern comedy. Cummings has released six stand-up specials, including Money Shot (2010), I Love You (2014), I‚Äôm Your Girlfriend (2016), Can I Touch It? (2019), Jokes (2022), and her latest, Mouthy, which debuted on OnlyFans in November 2023. She has also appeared in numerous television series and films, such as Good Mourning, Studio 666, How It Ends, and FOX‚Äôs Accused, further solidifying her presence on both the big and small screens. 
Beyond performing, Cummings is a successful author and filmmaker. In 2017, she published her memoir, I‚Äôm Fine‚Ä¶ And Other Lies, and made her directorial debut with the feature adaptation of Louann Brizendine‚Äôs bestseller, The Female Brain. She continues to create, produce, and perform across platforms, bringing her sharp humor and fearless perspective to audiences worldwide. She currently lives in Los Angeles.

description:
Back to All Shows


Live Nation Presents 
Ralph Barbosa: The Red 40 Tour

Sunday, March 15, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS
AGE RESTRICTION: 18 and above 
 
One of the shyest attention hogs ever to do comedy, Ralph Barbosa‚Äôs disarming and laid-back style has made him a stand-out on stage, on TV, and as host of the Formula Bean YouTube channel with Luis Cisneros. Last summer, Barbosa premiered his second hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Planet Bosa, as part of Hulu‚Äôs new Hularious comedy brand. 
His first hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Cowabunga, premiered on Netflix on October 31, 2023, and ranked as the #3 TV show on Netflix throughout its first week on the service. 
In July 2024, Barbosa was selected as one of Variety‚Äôs 10 Comics to Watch for 2024 and toured theaters throughout North America, including two sold-out theater shows as part of the Netflix Is A Joke Fest 2024, as well as hosting the kick-off show. 2023 was Barbosa‚Äôs break-out year, during which he was a guest on The Joe Rogan Experience, made his debut on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, and performed Comedy Central Stand-up Featuring: Ralph Barbosa, which topped 6 million views on YouTube. 
Barbosa also starred in the HBO Max comedy special, Entre Nos: The Winners 3 in 2022, and earlier that year his Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy performance was released on YouTube and now has over 6 million views.

Scottish Country Dancing is one of the predecessors of American Square Dancing. Everyone welcome! No partner is required. Comfortable shoes and a love of dance is all you need. Enjoy live music!

Classes are held every Monday with basics from 7:00-8:15, and more experienced dancers at 8:30-9:30.

First time free, then $10 for first or second session, or $12 for whole evening.

          $325.00
        
      
    
  

Thursdays, March 19 - May 7, 2026; 9:30am - 12:30pm$325An 8 session class for new or experienced weavers. New students will go through the complete process of setting up a loom and weave a simple scarf or table linens using a pickup lace technique. More experienced weavers are invited to explore woven pattern lace by weaving a project in a lace pattern such as Bronson, Swedish, or Huck lace. Materials not included. Project costs will vary. BUY TICKETS 
After four successful tours across the US, Colombian Latin-mariachi-pop singer, songwriter, and producer Carlos Daniels is back with M√°s Vivo Que Nunca¬† ‚Äì Juan Gabriel Tribute (More Alive Than Ever), a spectacle that thousands of fans across the nation are waiting for. 
Known as one of the best interpreters of El Divo De Juarez‚Äôs music, Daniels has conquered fans‚Äô hearts with impressive performances at renowned venues, including five shows at the House of Blues Mandalay Bay Casino in Las Vegas. On this new tour, Daniels, along with a Mariachi band, is determined to touch your soul by reviving some of Gabriel‚Äôs greatest hits, while delivering an unforgettable performance. M√°s Vivo Que Nunca ‚Äì Juan Gabriel Tribute will bring you a sea of emotions and memories, promising they will keep you singing along to every tune from the beginning until the end of the show.

3:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
Can the poutiest fish frown turn upside down? Find out in this extraordinary musical, featuring whimsical puppets and live performers in a sweeping oceanic adventure. When Mr. Fish sets out on a quest to find Miss Clam‚Äôs missing pearl, he discovers there is more to him than his permanently plastered pout. The writing team includes New Victory LabWorks Residency recipients Christopher Anselmo, Jared Corak, Matt Acheson, and Fergus Walsh. 
Recommended for ages 3-8, however, you know your child best.

Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under.

Wednesdays, March 25 - April 22, 2026 (6 sessions); 6pm-8:30pmClass fee: $210 + Materials fee: $40Ages 16 and upAll levels welcome (beginner to advanced)Intro to Throwing and HandbuildingThis is a great class for those who want to enjoy building something with their own hands and experience the personal benefits of working with clay. Instruction will cover the basics of wheel throwing, hand-building (slab, coil, freeform), and glazing techniques. Students will also have unstructured time to work on their own creations.The class will explore the benefits of letting go of the need to be productive and "perfect". The main goal of this course is to familiarize students with how clay rooms work and why they‚Äôre a fun place to be.About the Instructor: Alice Rathjen has over 40 years experience working with clay. She was a production potter for five years. The current focus of her ‚Äúart‚Äù is the sheer pleasure of playful engagement with clay. She enjoys throwing exquisite bowls, mugs and cups and seeing them go on adventures.

title: Upcycled Journal Workshop ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Upcycled Journal Workshop: 03/26/26

  
    
      
        
          $70.00
        
      
    
  

Thursday, March 26, 2026; 6PM-9PM$60 + $10 Materials feeA fun and creative workshop turning a cereal/snack box into a unique handmade journal. Using scissors we will remove parts of the boxes until we have what we will use as our cover. Then using miscellaneous papers we fold these into the pages of our journals. With simple book-binding skills using a needle and waxed thread we will stitch the pages into our covers. We will also decorate the covers of our journals with collage papers and/or paint.Examples of completed journals will be shown and step by step instruction will be provided along with all supplies. Short exercises to boost your creativity, journal prompts, and a small gift from me are also included.Whether you are a beginning or seasoned artist/writer/crafter or just looking to try something new, this is a great way to get inspired and create something meaningful to you.About the Instructor: Rendell Hourigan received a BBA in Marketing from Texas Tech University, and has pursued art for over 25 years, focusing on sustainable mixed media. She has studied with artists including Chery Baird, Jenny London, and Teri Sloat, exploring drawing, collage, and soft pastels. Her training includes workshops and courses in art journaling, mosaics, and mark-making. She‚Äôs exhibited work at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts, The Graton Gallery, and her SOFA district studio. Drawn to the beauty of discarded materials and passionate about recycling, she incorporates reclaimed materials into her work and now leads art workshops to inspire eco-conscious creativity in others.

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

title: Explore Gel Plate Printing ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Out of Stock
      
    




Explore Gel Plate Printing

  
    
      
        
          $130.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, March 28, 2026; 11 AM ‚Äì 3 PMFee: $115 + $15 materials feeAge: 16+ Participants: min. 8Learn to create beautiful designs on paper by printing with a gel plate and acrylic paint. Mixed media artist Catherine Cruz will teach you the basic skills for using this fun tool from printing textural backgrounds, to layering colors, and using stencils and other applications. You will take home many prints that can be used for designing collage, mixed media art or greeting cards. This class is suitable for anyone wanting to learn this unique mono printing style and perfect for beginners.What you‚Äôll get from this workshop: Methods for applying paint and pulling successful prints (Note: Magazine image transfer is not included in this class.), Techniques for creating intricate layered designs, Creative use of mark-making tools and masks, Strategies for combining techniques.A variety of papers will be provided but you are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to experiment on.IMPORTANT: Instructions for where to purchase your materials and how to prepare them is provided in the attached PDF. The instructor will start the class with a demonstration so please arrive a few minutes early to get set up so we can start on time.  We will take a short break for lunch between 12:30 and 1:00 pm so bring your lunch and a beverage.  About the instructor: Catherine Cruz is a French-American artist whose work is informed by textures and patterns created by the passing of time and the effects of the natural elements on the built environment.  She holds a Bachelor of Science in interior design and she worked in the field of architectural design and green building certification for over 25 years.  She has taught collage and mixed media workshops in the Bay Area and in France since 2019, and this is her fifth year at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts.  Her studio is located in Sebastopol and she participates in Art Trails Open Studios.  You may contact Catherine at beyouartstudio@gmail.com.  Check out Catherine‚Äôs other classes here:  https://wwws.sebarts.org/visual-arts-classes.

title: Observational Drawing 3-Week Course ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Observational Drawing 3-Week Course

  
    
      
        
          $175.00
        
      
    
  

Wednesdays, April 1 - April 15, 2026; 6-9PM$150 + $25 Materials FeeAges 16+In this three week course, participants will learn and practice observational skills and fundamental drawing techniques that will inform all of their other creative pursuits. This course is for anyone who wants to practice and advance their drawing skills - beginners, those who haven‚Äôt practiced in years, or any artists who just want to learn more and practice with consistent feedback and guidance. Learning to draw is truly learning to see - a skill that anyone can be taught, practice, and hone. Through demonstration, practice, and reflective discussion, this class will explore the foundations of classical drawing techniques in a low pressure environment. Observational drawing gives all artists a foundation of practical knowledge and skills that infinitely expands the possibilities of what one can create. If your ideas feel limited by your drawing skills, if you feel frustrated or stuck in your painting practice, or if you simply want to start drawing and are looking for a way to begin, this is the class for you. About the Instructor: Hannah Day received her BA in Visual Arts with an emphasis on drawing and printmaking from University of San Diego, then attended University of Hawaii at Manoa to receive her MFA in printmaking. Hannah‚Äôs etchings have been internationally shown and collected, but her personal practice also includes paper cutting, graphite, watercolor, mixed media, and murals. She have taught all ages and many formats (kids, teens, adults, college, private lessons, camps, etc) and many mediums. These days Hannah has been teaching primarily paper cutting but also enjoys teaching drawing, painting and printmaking.

title: ICON Concerts Presents Becky Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


ICON Concerts Presents¬†
Becky¬†Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour

Saturday, April 4, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Originally from Portland, Oregon, Becky Robinson is an LA-based comedian, writer, actor, and voice-over star who has gone from viral sensation to a sold-out theater act. 
You may also know her as the ‚ÄúEntitled Housewife,‚Äù the outspoken viral golf character Robinson created to co-star in two self-produced virtual comedy variety specials that helped spread laughter during the pandemic. Her unique character antics and viral videos have racked up millions of views across social media and garnered fans across the country (and the country clubs). In 2022, she released the original song ‚ÄúMama Needs a Claw.‚Äù 


VIP Add-On Option: 

Post Event Meet & Greet



 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Give 'Em the Axe! Ladies Night at the Range in Santa Rosa
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
Join us for an axe-throwing session to blow off some steam. I'm super excited to be able to offer a ladies' Axe-throwing night in Santa Rosa. If you've ever had a curiosity about this fun activity, this is your chance to find out more!

We have reserved a group spot with the indoor range on a Wednesday night. It will consist of an introductory lesson, and then we all get to practice taking turns. Everyone will get ample time to practice, as they have many lanes.

This event is focused on a less-competitive, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere. All skill levels are encouraged. All equipment and targets are provided by them, and we will probably get about 1 to 2 hours to enjoy ourselves.

I encourage everyone to bring a bottle of wine or a snack to share with the rest of the group (We usually end up with a lovely charcuterie and wine spread for everyone to enjoy).

There are 10 spots available, guests welcome. The ladies' group lesson and event is $30 person, paid to the range. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash. There may be standard liability forms to be filled out with the range. Closed-toed shoes are recommended.

Please only RSVP 'Yes' if you are able to make it, I will be doing a final headcount the day of. There is an attendance policy for all our events: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

Cheers, and hope to see you there!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

title: Annual Art of Dessert 2026
description:
Back to All Shows



The 23rd Annual Art of Dessert
The Art of Dessert¬†is LBC‚Äôs biggest fundraising event of the year. Over the years, it has raised more than $8 million to help provide enrichment in the arts to over 1 million children, families, and educators. 
Much anticipated, spirited, and delicious,¬†The¬†Art of Dessert¬†features sumptuous family-style dining, exceptional Rodney Strong Wine Estates wines, engaging entertainment, a silent and live auction, and, of course, decadent desserts by the best bakers in the county! Bid on unique live auction items and enjoy lively entertainment and engaging speakers. Sonoma County‚Äôs best fundraiser is a night to remember, and your support will make a difference for over 50,000 students, teachers, and families in the coming year. 
WHY YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS 
Thanks to your support, Luther Burbank Center for the Arts is the North Bay‚Äôs premier arts nonprofit, a vibrant gathering place providing world-class performances, a wide variety of community events, and nationally-recognized education programs that annually serve over 50,000 students, teachers, and families. 
Tickets and more information coming soon!

Tickets and more information coming soon! 


Join the Fun ‚Äì Join the Cause!
There are many ways to get involved with The Art of Dessert and support children, teachers, families, and artists in our community, even from home!

If you have an item or experience that you‚Äôd like to donate, please contact Barbara Arriaga, Member and Donor Relations, at 707.800.7541 or barriaga@lutherburbankcenter.org 


Sponsorships 
Sponsorships are available for this beloved annual event. Get your name in front of hundreds of the most generous and connected members of the community. 
For more information, contact Ben Taylor, Director of Philanthropy, at 707.800.7505 or btaylor@lutherburbankcenter.org

title: Emmylou Harris
description:
Back to All Shows


Emmylou¬†Harris

Friday, April 17, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Billboard¬†Century Award recipient, Harris‚Äô contribution as a singer and songwriter spans 40 years. She has recorded more than 25 albums and has lent her talents to countless fellow artists‚Äô recordings. In recognition of her remarkable career, Harris was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2008 and earned a Grammy Lifetime Achievement award in 2018. 
Harris is one of the most admired and influential women in music. She has recorded with such diverse artists as Linda Ronstadt, Daniel Lanois, Bob Dylan, Mark Knopfler, Neil Young, Gram Parsons, Willie Nelson, Dolly Parton, Roy Orbison, Ryan Adams, Beck, Elvis Costello, Johnny Cash, Lucinda Williams, Lyle Lovett and Rodney Crowell. Few artists have achieved such honesty or have revealed such maturity in their writing. Forty years into her career, Harris continues to share the hard-earned wisdom that‚Äîhopefully if not inevitably‚Äîcomes with getting older, though she‚Äôs never stopped looking ahead.

Fresh off the release of Magic Lover, Netflix‚Äôs first-ever magic comedy special, Justin Willman is hitting the road with his all-new One for the Ages tour. Willman is best known as the star and creator of Netflix‚Äôs Magic for Humans and Magic Prank Show, where his signature mix of mind-blowing magic and relatable humor has made him a streaming favorite, a viral hit (1 billion views and counting), and a fan favorite for families, comedy lovers, and skeptics alike. 
He‚Äôs appeared on The Tonight Show, The Today Show, The Kelly Clarkson Show, and Conan, and he was recently named ‚ÄúStage Magician of the Year‚Äù by the Magic Castle. He‚Äôs performed at the White House, packed theaters across the country, and managed to make grown adults openly weep over a card trick. But the live show? That‚Äôs where the real magic happens. 
One for the Ages is Justin‚Äôs biggest tour to date, featuring brand-new material and more. It‚Äôs an interactive, laugh-filled, sleight-of-mind experience that‚Äôs smart, silly, and astonishing. This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

Source: Meetup: Women's Wine Club

Ada Twist, Scientist & Friends
by TheaterWorksUSA


Sunday, May 3, 2026

3:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
When Ms. Greer‚Äôs classroom field trip goes awry, three out-of-the-box thinkers must pull their STEM skills together to save the day! Meet Rosie Revere and her engineering dreams, Iggy Peck, with her relentless passion for architecture, and Ada Twist, whose science curiosity leads her to some adventurous problem solving. In this live musical performance, our heroes face the ultimate test of their problem-solving skills‚Äîa test that can only be conquered through teamwork. Don‚Äôt miss this fun musical based on the Andrea Beaty books,¬†Rosie Revere, Engineer; Iggy Peck, Architect, and Ada Twist, Scientist, which spotlight the STEM curriculum (focusing on science, technology, engineering and math). 
Recommended for ages 5-9, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 60 minutes 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video.

Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. description:

David Sedaris

Friday, May 8, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
David Sedaris is one of America‚Äôs pre-eminent humor writers. He is a master of satire and one of today‚Äôs most observant writers. 
Beloved for his personal essays and short stories, David Sedaris is the author of the New York Times bestsellers Barrel Fever, Holidays on Ice, Naked, Me Talk Pretty One Day, Dress Your Family in Corduroy and Denim, When You Are Engulfed in Flames, Let‚Äôs Explore Diabetes with Owls, and Calypso. His book, The Best of Me, collects 42 previously published stories and essays. Sedaris also wrote Squirrel Seeks Chipmunk: A Modest Bestiary, a collection of fables with illustrations by Ian Falconer. He is the editor of Children Playing Before a Statue of Hercules: An Anthology of Outstanding Stories. His pieces regularly appear in The New Yorker and have twice been included in ‚ÄúThe Best American Essays.‚Äù

title: Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars
description:

Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars

Saturday, May 9, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Modern Mississippi Hill Country¬†band North Mississippi Allstars and blues legend¬†Bobby Rush¬†are co-headlining this unique event, with each artist performing separately before joining together to honor their Mississippi blues roots. 
North Mississippi Allstars was started by brothers Luther and Cody Dickinson in 1996 as a loose collective of musicians from their North Mississippi home. They were inspired by their father Jim Dickinson as well as neighbors and musical elders of their community, including RL Burnside, Junior Kimbrough, Otha Turner, and Fred McDowell.¬†They have multiple Grammy¬Æ nominations for their acclaimed experimental albums, and the latest album, Still Shakin‚Äô, is out now. 
The 91-year-old Bobby Rush is a three-time Grammy Award¬Æ winner for ‚ÄúBest Traditional Blues Album‚Äù for Porcupine Meat, Rawer than Raw, and 2024‚Äôs All My Love for You. He is also a 16-time Blues Music Awards winner (with 56 career nominations) and has been inducted into the Blues Hall of Fame, Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame and Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame.

title: Paul Anka: A Man and His Music
description:
Back to All Shows


Paul Anka: A Man and His Music

Thursday, May 21, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
With his craftsmanship as a master songwriter and his youthful tenor sound, Paul Anka has been crooning his way to fans‚Äô hearts with a polished blend of classic pop and rock-and-roll energy. 
His duets albums, Body of Work in 1998 that features Frank Sinatra, Celine Dion, Tom Jones and daughter Anthea Anka, and Duets in 2013 with Frank Sinatra, Michael Jackson, Tom Jones, Celine Dion, and Michael Bubl√©, celebrate his lifelong collaborations with a variety of artists. Duets set a milestone in Billboard Chart history because, with the CD, Anka became the only artist to have a CD on the Billboard Top 100 Chart for seven consecutive decades. 
At 81 years old, Paul Anka continues to write and record. His latest two albums, Making Memories and Sessions, were released in 2021 and 2022 respectively. The albums featured new and never-before recorded songs as well as new takes on old classics, notably ‚ÄúPut Your Head On My Shoulder,‚Äù with Olivia Newton John, one of her last recorded songs, and ‚ÄúMy Way,‚Äù featuring Michael Buble and Andrea Bocelli.

title: LBC‚Äôs Afterschool Mariachi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs present 2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration
description:
Back to All Shows


LBC‚Äôs Afterschool Mariachi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs present
2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration

Thursday, May 28, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Celebrate the rich cultural traditions of Mexico through the vibrant artistry of the musicians and dancers in LBC‚Äôs afterschool Marichi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs at Voces y Pasos (Voices and Steps): A Cultural Celebration. Featuring more than 150 of Sonoma County‚Äôs talented youth, Voces y Pasos brings these traditions and celebrations to life in an unforgettable stage performance that pays tribute to their Mexican heritage. 
LBC‚Äôs Mariachi Ensemble and its sister program, LBC‚Äôs Ballet Folkl√≥rico, enroll students from all over the county. Together they deliver stunning performances that blend technical skill, stage presence, and heartfelt expression while embodying the grace and vibrancy of traditional Mexican folk music and dance. 
The young performers in these programs devote themselves to weekly rehearsals and regular performances at community events that continue to shape them into impressive artists. Thanks to the generosity of our donors and sponsors, they can participate at no cost to their families, with all equipment and costumes provided. Join us for an inspiring evening that shines the spotlight on the voices and steps of these talented students and honors the enduring power of culture, tradition, and community.

title: I‚Äôm With Her
description:
Back to All Shows


I‚Äôm With Her

Saturday, June 6, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


With the 2014 formation of I‚Äôm With Her, singer/songwriters Sarah Jarosz, Aoife O‚ÄôDonovan, and Sara Watkins introduce an essential new force into the world of folk music: a close-knit alliance of highly esteemed musicians, each graced with a deep understanding of folk tradition and unbridled passion for expanding its possibilities. 
On their long awaited second LP, Wild and Clear and Blue, their luminous harmonies infuse a soul-searching body of work that explores themes of ancestry, lineage, and the collective human experience with stories about reaching into the past, navigating a chaotic present, and bravely moving forward into the unknown. It follows a critically lauded debut album, See You Around, and standalone singles, like ‚ÄúCall My Name‚Äù (winner of the 2020 Grammy for Best American Roots Song). 
All multi-Grammy-winners with deep roots in the folk scene, Watkins, Jarosz, and O‚ÄôDonovan first discovered their chemistry during an impromptu performance at the 2014 Telluride Bluegrass Festival, then co-founded I‚Äôm With Her, and began touring extensively and performing at acclaimed festivals across the globe. 
Produced by Josh Kaufman‚Äîa member of Bonny Light Horseman and multi-instrumentalist/songwriter/arranger/producer who‚Äôs worked with Bob Weir and The National‚ÄîWild and Clear and Blue ultimately adds a bold new urgency to their delicate entangling of lived-in narrative, fable-like storytelling, and nuanced reflection on cycles of life. 
I‚Äôm With Her has partnered with PLUS1 so that $1 per ticket goes to supporting organizations working for equity, access, and dignity for all.¬†www.plus1.org

description:
Back to All Shows


Press Democrat Presents
North Coast Wine & Food Festival

Saturday, June 13, 2026

12:00 pm VIP Entry
1:00 pm General Admission


BUY TICKETS 


Get ready for a day of indulgence, discovery, and celebration at the North Coast Wine & Food Festival, the North Bay‚Äôs premier showcase of exceptional wines and culinary talent. The festival brings together gold-medal-winning wines from Sonoma, Napa, and Mendocino counties, alongside inspired bites from some of the region‚Äôs most celebrated chefs. Guests are invited to sip, savor, and connect‚Äîmeeting the winemakers behind the pours and tasting dishes that reflect the rich agricultural and cultural diversity of the North Coast. 
From elegant caviar to bold barbecue and globally inspired flavors, the culinary offerings are as diverse as they are delicious, all complemented by live music and the vibrant energy of wine country. As festival attendee Dennis McCarter of McCarter Cellars shared, ‚ÄúThe great food at the event elevates the great wine, and the great wine elevates the great food.‚Äù Established as a must-attend event for food and wine lovers alike, the North Coast Wine & Food Festival is more than a tasting‚Äîit‚Äôs a joyful celebration of craftsmanship, community, and the good life. 
Must be 21 or older to attend. 
Designated driver tickets are available, along with a limited selection of non-alcoholic beverages.

Back to All Shows


The Australian Pink Floyd Show

Saturday, August 8, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Performing the music of Pink Floyd with note for note perfection, The Australian Pink Floyd Show (TAPFS) has been astonishing audiences worldwide for more than three decades. Always striving to reproduce the complete Pink Floyd experience and bring the music to new audiences, the show continues to include a stunning light and laser show, video animations, state of the art, high resolution LED screen technology, and other special effects. In addition, and in true Pink Floyd fashion, there are several huge inflatables, including a giant pig and their own unique Pink Kangaroo. 
TAPFS has worked with Pink Floyd touring musicians like Guy Pratt and Durga McBroom. Lorelei McBroom, who was a member of the Pink Floyd touring band on both the Momentary Lapse of Reason and the Delicate Sound of Thunder tours has been a member of TAPFS for more than 15 years. 
Often described as being much more than a tribute band, The Australian Pink Floyd Show is the first Pink Floyd tribute show that took the concept into the worldwide arena circuit. The band has played to sell-out audiences throughout Europe, UK, America, Canada & South America. With more than 35 years of history, the world‚Äôs biggest, best and greatest Pink Floyd tribute show continues to delight its global fan base.

The Rush Tribute Project is an homage to one of the most enduring and influential bands in rock music. Combining skilled musicianship with exciting performances, The Rush Tribute Project (known as RTP to its dedicated fanbase) painstakingly recreates the sound and energy that made Rush one of the top-selling rock bands of all time. Using vintage instruments, multi-camera projection, state-of-the-art lighting & lasers, and signature virtuosity, RTP will be performing two full sets of music, including Moving Pictures in its entirety, as well as deep cuts like ‚ÄúLa Villa Strangiato‚Äù and ‚ÄúEnter Nous.‚Äù 
Having performed for more than a decade across North America and around the world, including RushCon, RTP stands as one of the premiere tributes to this legendary rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll power trio.

title: Leonid & Friends 2026 Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Emporium Presents
Leonid & Friends 2026 Tour

Saturday, November 7, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Leonid & Friends is a globally acclaimed, genre-defying 11-piece collective renowned for their astonishingly precise recreations of classic Chicago songs, as well as high-energy performances of other rock, pop, and jazz-fusion hits from the 1970s. Formed by multi-talented musician and producer¬†Leonid Vorobyev, the group features elite vocalists and instrumentalists from Russia, Ukraine, Moldova, and beyond, all united by a shared passion for celebrating this iconic era of music. 
Originally conceived as a studio project in Moscow, Leonid & Friends skyrocketed to international fame when their note-perfect video covers went viral online, earning praise from members of Chicago themselves. What began as a YouTube phenomenon has since evolved into a world-class touring act, captivating audiences across North America, Europe, and Asia. 
With more than¬†500 million combined video views, multiple sold-out U.S. tours, and a devoted global fanbase, the band is beloved worldwide for honoring the classics, while expanding far beyond them 


After-show Meet & Greet
Meet & Greet is a wonderful opportunity for fans to meet and interact with Leonid & Friends. Quantity is limited at each show.
